ProtocolTitle.description: Full, official title of the clinical trial protocol as written on the cover page or in the study synopsis. Typically appears near the sponsor name and protocol number. May be labeled as 'Protocol Title', 'Full Title', 'Official Title', or 'Study Title'. Extract the complete title text, not an abbreviation.

ShortTitle.description: Short or abbreviated title used to refer to the study throughout the document. Often appears in headers, footers, or summary sections and may be labeled as 'Short Title', 'Abbreviated Title', or 'Study Name'. Extract the concise title used in repeated references, even if it differs from the full protocol title.

ProtocolNumber.description: Unique identifier assigned to the protocol by the sponsor. Commonly labeled as 'Protocol No.', 'Protocol Number', or 'Study ID' and found on the cover page, headers, or footers next to the study title and sponsor name. Extract the full identifier including letters, numbers, and punctuation (for example, 'ABC-1234-001').

DocumentVersionIdentifier.description: Version identifier or number of the current protocol document, such as 'Version 1.0' or 'Amendment 2'. Typically appears on the cover page, title page, or in document headers and may be labeled as 'Version', 'Protocol Version', 'Amendment Number', or 'Amendment ID'. Extract the complete version label as written.

DocumentVersionDate.description: Date associated with the current protocol version or amendment. Usually found on the cover page or near the version identifier and may be labeled as 'Version Date', 'Protocol Date', 'Effective Date', or 'Amendment Date'. Extract the date that corresponds to the active protocol version, not historical or planned dates.

SponsorName.description: Legal or corporate name of the organization serving as the study sponsor. Typically appears on the cover page, 'Sponsor Information' section, or headers and may be labeled as 'Sponsor', 'Study Sponsor', or 'Sponsor/Company'. Extract the full sponsor name without addresses or contact details.

SponsorAddressLine.description: Street address line for the sponsor’s primary office or legal address. Usually appears near the sponsor name on the cover page, title page, or in a 'Sponsor Information' section. Extract only the street portion (for example, '123 Main Street, Suite 400') and not the city, state, or postal code.

SponsorCityStateCountryPostal.description: City, state/region, country, and postal code corresponding to the sponsor’s address. Often follows the street address in the 'Sponsor' or 'Contact Information' section. May be formatted as 'City, State ZIP, Country' or equivalent international formats. Extract the full location line as written.

StudyIndication.description: Disease or condition under study, such as 'metastatic breast cancer' or 'SARS-CoV-2 infection'. Typically appears in the synopsis, background, or 'Study Description' sections and may be labeled as 'Indication', 'Disease Area', 'Condition', or 'Therapeutic Area'. Extract the primary medical condition or population focus in a short phrase.

ClinicalTrialsGovId.description: Registration identifier assigned by ClinicalTrials.gov for the study. Commonly labeled as 'ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier', 'NCT Number', or 'Registry ID' and often appears in the synopsis, administrative, or registry information sections. Format is typically 'NCT' followed by 8 digits (for example, 'NCT01234567'). Extract the full NCT identifier.

StudyPhase.description: Phase of clinical development for the study, such as 'Phase 1', 'Phase 2', 'Phase 3', 'Phase 4', or a combined phase (for example, 'Phase 1/2'). Typically appears on the cover page, in the synopsis, or in 'Study Design' sections and may be labeled as 'Study Phase', 'Phase of Development', or 'Clinical Phase'. Extract the phase description exactly as written.

StudyType.description: High-level classification of the study, such as 'Interventional', 'Observational', or 'Expanded Access'. Usually appears in the synopsis, 'Study Design', or 'Administrative' sections and may be labeled as 'Study Type' or 'Type of Study'. Extract the descriptor used to classify the overall study design.

StudyDesignSummary.description: Narrative summary of the overall study design, including key elements such as randomization, blinding, control groups, number of arms, and main design features. Typically found in the 'Study Design', 'Study Overview', or 'Synopsis' sections and may be labeled as 'Study Design', 'Design Overview', or 'Design Summary'. Extract the paragraph or section that explains how the study is structured, without expanding into detailed procedures or schedules.

StudyPopulationSummary.description: High-level description of the target participant population. Often appears in the synopsis, 'Study Population', 'Study Overview', or 'Background and Rationale' sections and may be labeled as 'Study Population', 'Target Population', or 'Patient Population'. Extract text that summarizes key characteristics such as disease or condition, age group, and any defining demographic or clinical features.

AgeEligibility.description: Description of the age range of participants eligible to enroll in the study. Typically found in 'Eligibility Criteria', 'Key Inclusion Criteria', or 'Study Population' sections and may be labeled as 'Age Range', 'Age Limits', or 'Age and Sex Eligibility'. Extract the text that states minimum and/or maximum age (for example, 'Adults ≥18 years' or '18 to 65 years').

InclusionCriteria.description: Block of text listing conditions that must be met for a participant to be eligible for the study. Usually appears in the 'Eligibility Criteria' section under headings such as 'Inclusion Criteria', 'Key Inclusion Criteria', or 'Main Inclusion Criteria'. Often formatted as a numbered or bulleted list. Extract the full inclusion criteria text, preserving list structure where possible.

ExclusionCriteria.description: Block of text listing conditions that disqualify a participant from enrolling in the study. Typically found in the 'Eligibility Criteria' section under headings such as 'Exclusion Criteria', 'Key Exclusion Criteria', or 'Main Exclusion Criteria', often following the inclusion criteria. Usually presented as a numbered or bulleted list. Extract the full exclusion criteria text, preserving list structure where possible.

PrimaryObjectives.description: Text describing the main goals of the study, usually focused on efficacy, safety, or tolerability of the investigational product. Commonly found in 'Objectives and Endpoints', 'Study Objectives', or 'Synopsis' sections under a heading such as 'Primary Objective' or 'Primary Objectives'. Extract the statement or list of statements that specify what the study is primarily designed to evaluate.

SecondaryObjectives.description: Text describing secondary goals of the study, often related to additional efficacy, safety, pharmacokinetics, or exploratory outcomes. Typically located in 'Objectives and Endpoints', 'Study Objectives', or 'Synopsis' sections under a heading such as 'Secondary Objectives'. Extract the statement or list of statements labeled as secondary objectives, separate from primary objectives.

PrimaryEndpoints.description: Description of the primary outcome measures used to assess the primary objectives of the study. Typically found in 'Objectives and Endpoints', 'Outcome Measures', or 'Efficacy/Safety Endpoints' sections under a heading such as 'Primary Endpoints' or 'Primary Efficacy Endpoints'. Extract the definition of each primary endpoint, including the variable measured, method of assessment, and key timepoints when provided.

SecondaryEndpoints.description: Description of secondary outcome measures used to assess secondary objectives. Usually located in 'Objectives and Endpoints', 'Outcome Measures', or 'Efficacy/Safety Endpoints' sections under a heading such as 'Secondary Endpoints' or 'Secondary Outcome Measures'. Extract the descriptions of secondary endpoints as written, separate from primary endpoints.

TotalPlannedEnrollment.description: Total number of participants planned for enrollment in the study across all sites and arms. Commonly labeled as 'Planned Enrollment', 'Target Sample Size', 'Total Number of Subjects', or 'Number of Participants' and appears in the synopsis, 'Study Design', or 'Sample Size' sections. Extract the numeric value for overall planned enrollment, not per-site or per-arm counts.

StudyArms.description: Collection of study arms or treatment groups defined in the protocol. Each item represents a distinct arm with its label and main intervention description. Arms are typically described in 'Study Design', 'Treatment Arms', 'Interventions', or 'Study Groups' sections.

ArmLabel.description: Name or label of the study arm, such as 'Arm A: Investigational Drug', 'Placebo Arm', or 'Standard of Care'. Usually appears in 'Study Design', 'Treatment Arms', or 'Interventions' sections and may be labeled as 'Arm', 'Group', 'Cohort', or 'Treatment Regimen'. Extract the full text label for the arm.

ArmType.description: High-level classification of the arm such as 'Experimental', 'Active Comparator', 'Placebo', or 'Standard of Care'. This may be stated directly next to the arm label or in the intervention description. Extract the descriptive term that characterizes the role of the arm in the study.

ArmInterventionSummary.description: Summary of the intervention for the arm, including investigational product name(s), dose, route, frequency, and key treatment features. Typically found under arm-specific headings in 'Interventions', 'Study Treatment', or 'Study Design' sections. Extract the narrative that describes what participants in this arm receive.

ScheduleOfAssessmentsTables.description: All Schedule of Assessments (SoA) or Study Visit Matrix tables that describe visits and procedures over time. Typically found in sections titled 'Schedule of Assessments', 'Schedule of Activities', 'Study Procedures', 'Visit Schedule', or in appendices. These tables may span multiple pages and include screening, treatment, and follow-up schedules. Extract each SoA-related table as HTML while preserving rows, columns, headers, and footnotes.

items.description: HTML representation of a single Schedule of Assessments or visit schedule table, including header rows, body rows, and any footnotes that appear under the table.

ScheduleOfAssessmentsSectionText.description: Full text of the main Schedule of Assessments section, including headings, table captions, legends, footnotes, and any narrative paragraphs that explain visit timing, windows, conditional procedures, or unscheduled visits. Look for sections titled 'Schedule of Assessments', 'Schedule of Activities', 'Study Procedures', 'Visit Schedule', or similar. Extract continuous text that provides context around the SoA tables.

UnscheduledVisitNarrative.description: Narrative description of unscheduled visits or additional visits triggered by adverse events, clinical findings, or investigator judgment. Typically located near the Schedule of Assessments, safety, or visit description sections and may be labeled as 'Unscheduled Visits', 'Unscheduled Assessments', or appear in notes such as 'if clinically indicated'. Extract the text that explains when and why unscheduled visits occur and what is performed at those visits.

ConditionalOrOptionalProceduresNarrative.description: Text describing procedures that are performed only under certain conditions, are optional, or apply to specific subgroups (for example, 'if clinically indicated', 'for WOCBP only', 'optional biopsy', or 'performed in case of suspected toxicity'). Look for these statements in Schedule of Assessments footnotes, safety sections, or procedure descriptions. Extract the narrative that explains the conditions or optional nature of these procedures.
